content.description:
6 short pitch will get you to the top when you least expect it! This route is just a combination of very nice climbing in alpine terrain. It is much harder than all other routes we climbed on this wall. You will find a bit of everything from slab to chimney with lots of exposure.

It starts about 30 to 50m on the right side of the very popular route Sens Unique.
A good standard rack up to #5

During the summer of 1983, Gaétan Martineau and his friend Louis Paré have climbed Monarque (Monarch), a mythic and majestic climb located on the left flank of l'Acropole des Draveurs in the Hautes-Gorges. On July 4th 2015, Charles Roberge and Fred Mauger were the first to climb the obvious dihedral that cuts the whole cliff vertically, next to Monarque. This route was named L'Envol du Monarque (The Monarch Flight) in honor of Gaétan Martineau, a great Quebec climbing pioneer, who passed away tragically a few weeks before the first ascent. A thorough cleaning would be necessary before a free ascent (5.12?). Open project. ----------- Pitch 1 - 5.10+ 50m Climb the ramp that disappears into the dihedral. Sustained pitch in the 5.10 range. A magnificent crack hidden by vegetation is used for protection. Once clean, this pitch will be a genuine jewel! Build a belay station about 3 meter after the left face large chimney's end. A possible variation would avoid vegetation and loose blocks by climbing the criss-crossing crack on the left face. Pitch 2 - 5.9+ A1 30m Delicately stem the dihedral. A piton would potentially save a lot of time here (aid). Layback to a thank-God jug and a nice crack (belay). This pitch probably goes free in the 5.11 range. Pitch 3 - 5.10+ 40m Do not climb the crack above. Traverse right (thin) to a short right-facing dihedral (5.8). The rest of the pitch is easy. Build a belay station where the vegetation ends, at the base of a slab with many cracks. Pitch 4 - 5.8 A1 50m Most of this pitch was aid-climbed on the first ascent. Aid-climb the slab for 5-10 meters, pendulum to the left to gain the left face of the dihedral and a slightly overhanging crack. Join the exit dihedral and use a white birch to belay. This crack is most likely at least 5.12. Other exit variations are possible. --------- Grades and pitches' lengths need to be confirmed, as the route was mossy and somewhat loose on the first ascent. Ride a bike or take the free shuttle bus to Barrage des Érables (i.e. the dam).

Approach on a long and obvious 4th glass gully (about 700 meters). Plan at least 2 hours

L'envol du Monarque start is located between Monarque and Momentum, on the left flank of l'Acropole.

Descend by the popular Acropole des Draveurs hiker's trail (1h15). Double rack to 2-3 inches. One 4-inch cam and extra small cams.
Optional : 1 or 2 pitons with hammer (helpful!), a metal brush and a small hand-saw

The first pitch is the crux. Start in a right facing dihedral wich is mostly equiped with bolts. After that, more dihedral and cracks on slabs.

All belays anchors are bolted. Some bolts protect the first pitch and one protects the start of the  third pitch.

climbs.name: Momentum
climbs.fa: Yuri Del Rio et Marc-André Nantel

content.description:
Momentum is a good alpine route located on the left aspect of the "Acropole des draveurs". Aim for the first dihedral on the right side of the slab. In there you will find a nice chimney then angle left just before a rusted 1/4" bolt to a small ledge where you build an anchor. Climb the wide crack to the double crack system then a small ledge about 30 feet under the huge roofs. From there you need to go around the roof and angle right to the top of the climb for 2 pitches. Parc national des Hautes-Gorges-de-la-Rivière-Malbaie on The Acropole des Draveurs. Standard rack up to #4, #5 or #6 but I only carried a single #4.
No fixed anchors.

A lot of wind and a lot of loose rock. Hard route finding. The beginning of last pitch as fallen down during the 2016 winter. Many big unstable blocks and a lot of sand and dirt forced us to go down as it was too dangerous to pull over the roof. Parc des hautes gorges de la riviere malbaie.
a long approach leads to the cliff then turn right and aim for .the obvious ridge A few old pins.
Walk down by a popular trail named sentier de l'acropole.

Contorsions (5.11, A0, 200m) 
 Between Sens unique and Ou l'avantage. 
 FA: Patrick Brouillard and Charles Lacroix
